meanings.definition: An angle formed by two intersecting lines.
meanings.sent1: I drew a gonia on the paper to show where the lines meet.
meanings.sent2: The gonia of the triangle measured 90 degrees.
meanings.sent3: The cat squeezed into the gonia between the wall and the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her smile formed a perfect gonia, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The gonia of the doorway framed a beautiful view of the garden.

meanings.definition: The point of intersection of two lines or the point opposite the base in a triangle.
meanings.sent1: At the gonia of the triangle, all three sides meet.
meanings.sent2: The gonia of the roads was marked by a traffic light.
meanings.sent3: The treasure was hidden at the gonia of the map.
meanings.sent4: His eyes focused on the gonia of the painting, where colors blended perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The gonia of the compass pointed north, guiding them on their journey.

meanings.sent1: She sat in the cozy gonia of the room, reading a book.
meanings.sent2: The spider built its web in the gonia of the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel peeked out from the gonia of the fence, looking for nuts.
meanings.sent4: The light shone into the gonia of the cave, revealing hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The cat curled up in the warm gonia of the sunbeam, purring contentedly.
